body_content.explanation: coming from or having the belief that disabled people (= people who have an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for them to do things that most other people can do) are not as good as people who are not disabled, or that they do not deserve special arrangements that help them to live their lives and be included in society:
examples: The book was criticized for its ableist themes.

body_content.explanation: relating to policies, behaviours, rules, etc. that result in unfair or harmful treatment of disabled people (= people who have an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for them to do things that most other people can do) and in a continued unfair advantage to people who are not disabled:
examples: An ableist society is one that treats non-disabled individuals as the standard of “normal living”.
